subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Saturday, 21 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Live - Man Utd v Middlesbrough
Top-of-the-table Man Utd aim to restore their six-point lead in the Premiership against Middlesbrough.



 
Watford 1-1 Man City
Watford are relegated from the Premiership after failing to beat Manchester City at Vicarage Road.



 
Charlton 1-1 Sheff Utd
Jonathan Stead scores a priceless equaliser for Sheffield United which keeps Charlton in the bottom three.








GOLF




Scot Yates makes Shanghai surge
Scotland's Simon Yates fires a 64 to surge into a tie for third after three rounds of the Asian Open in Shanghai.



 
Asian Open leaderboard
Latest scores from the third round of the BMW Asian Open in Shanghai.



 
Calcavecchia shines in Louisiana
Mark Calcavecchia takes a one-shot lead after the second round of the New Orleans Classic.








MOTORSPORT




Istanbul pole for on-song Rossi
Valentino Rossi puts his Yamaha on pole for Sunday's Turkish MotoGP, just ahead of team-mate Colin Edwards.



 
BMW may offer Heidfeld new deal
Nick Heidfeld's impressive start to the season could go a long way to landing a new deal with BMW Sauber.



 
Nascar honours Virginia victims
Nascar is to honour the 32 victims of the Virginia Tech shooting tragedy at its next three races.








FORMULA ONE




BMW may offer Heidfeld new deal
Nick Heidfeld's impressive start to the season could go a long way to landing a new deal with BMW Sauber.



 
Schumacher vows to answer critics
Ralf Schumacher aims to turn around his season when his Toyota car is "competitive again"



 
Hamilton 'could become best ever'
Lewis Hamilton could go on to become the greatest racing driver of all time, his McLaren boss Martin Whitmarsh says.








ATHLETICS




Star duo renew marathon rivalry
Haile Gebrselassie and Paul Tergat head a star-studded field for this Sunday's London Marathon.



 
Gebrselassie targets London 2012
Distance legend Haile Gebrselassie plans to extend his career and compete in the London 2012 Olympics.



 
Weir confident of marathon repeat
Britain's Dave Weir believes he can retain his London Marathon wheelchair title on Sunday.








CYCLING




Tour will snub dope-probe riders
Tour de France chief says riders implicated in the Spanish doping scandal will not be welcome at this year's race.



 
Landis lines up return to racing
Floyd Landis will ride in events in the US this summer despite the ongoing doping inquiry into his 2006 Tour de France win.



 
Cavendish claims Belgian success
British cyclist Mark Cavendish held off a world-class field to win the Scheldeprijs Vlaanderen in Belgium.








FUN AND GAMES




Marathon man bucks his ideas up
A Harlequins rugby league fan is running the London Marathon dressed as Buck, the club's mascot.



 
Holloway column
Gary's fiery and he says 'You what?' The bloke says '£500,000 for a midget?'



 
Review of the week
Lionel Messi's wonder goal matches Maradona, while Fletcher feels the heat
